question: [File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/switchboard_sui/on_demand/sources/actions/oracle/oracle_init_action.move] [Function: validate()] [Error Message] EOracleKeyExists at line 10 is the error for duplicate keys - is this error message sufficient for users to understand which oracle_key conflicted, or can it cause confusion in multi-oracle systems? (Medium)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/switchboard_sui/on_demand/sources/actions/oracle/oracle_init_action.move] [Function: validate()] [Queue State] The validate function reads queue.version() and queue.existing_oracles_contains() - can stale Queue state be passed if the Queue is modified in a previous transaction in the same PTB? (High)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/switchboard_sui/on_demand/sources/actions/oracle/oracle_init_action.move] [Function: actuate()] [Queue Mutation] The actuate function mutates Queue via add_existing_oracle - can this violate Queue invariants if called from an unexpected context or with a malformed Queue reference? [File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/switchboard_sui/on_demand/sources/actions/oracle/oracle_init_action.move] [Function: actuate()] [Queue Methods] The code calls queue.id(), queue.queue_key(), and queue.add_existing_oracle() - are these guaranteed to be atomic, or can queue state change mid-execution? (Medium)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/switchboard_sui/on_demand/sources/actions/oracle/oracle_init_action.move] [Function: actuate()] [Oracle Creation] The oracle::new call is package-scoped based on the dependency - can this prevent unauthorized oracle creation, or can other packages with switchboard dependency also call oracle::new?
